Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jimboscott> @Godballz Staking is an incentive to those who have coins to keep their wallets and connections open in support of the network.  It is a bit like mining as far as luck and probability go, but instead of leveraging computational power in an effort to achieve a consensus on a transaction, coins are leveraged.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <LOUD Mining> @oscar anytime you make a transaction with your wallet, POS stops and you have to restart to continue staking available coins. At least that's what I understand about POS wallets.

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @LOUD Mining actually, that's not the case with Verus

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> the only coins that stop staking are the ones from the source transaction for the new transaction, because their age gets reset and they need to wait another 150 blocks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <iO_User> Just glad we had a small increase in hashrate, it's the perfect balance. 

I think the 2 worst case scenarios would have been a massive increase (so we all get less rewards), or no increase (indicating a lack of interest). 

However it may be that those mining now are just the existing community, but just put more hashpower on. 

But I'm optimistic with time and through spreading the word, people will start to understand the value of this coin and help us grow.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <englal> @garnettfan The coinbases (block rewards) can only be spent to a private address in an action called "shielding" you need to shield the coins, then you can use them as any other coins, such as sending them to a private address to stake with.

If you're using Agama there's an option in the send interface (might only show up after you select private tx, I can't remember as I only really use CLI) to shield coinbases.

If you're using CLI you need to use the z_shieldcoinbase command.
